column4: How would I install the 32 bit version of the MySQL dev libraries on my system? I am on a 64 bit install of Ubuntu but I need to build some stuff that links against MySQL and needs to be running on a 32 bit machine.
frostburn3: negative. I cannot. I need to build and package everything here on my machine. would be nice to have the luxury but often you can't have access to the target.
surely I can just install the 32 bit mysql libs here
are you terminal based only or do you have a gui?
the machine I am on is gui
search synaptic for mysql .. hopefully you should see a reference for the -dev file
synaptic says I have the dev files installed already... presumaby because I do. but I only have the 64 bit version
ah.. you looking for the 32 bit?
affirmative. I am 64 bit but trying to build 32 bit.
do you already have the 32 bit libs install as well?
jaunty. I got way too f*cked over by Karmic on my two other machines to mess with it on my main baby.
I don't think the 32 bit libs are installed. that's the whole problem.
I think that synaptic is right in saying I have the libs... I do, but it does not give me a way to say "hey, I want 32 bit versions too, so install em!"
I'm looking in packages.ubuntu.com to see what's there.
I don't see either version there.. at least one starting with mysql-XXX.. there are some libs with the -dev at the end but you can't tell if they are 32 or 64 bit
could be why synaptic does not know squat about this...
